20 JAHRE VILLA STUCK LOGO
FÖRDERVEREIN VILLA STUCK
20 JAHRE VILLA STUCK POSTER
ZEICHEN & WUNDER Munich, GERMANY

Advertiser :FÖRDERVEREIN VILLA STUCK
Product :20 JAHRE VILLA STUCK POSTER
Entrant :ZEICHEN & WUNDER Munich, GERMANY
Type of Entry :Graphic Design & Design Crafts
Category :Posters
Title :20 JAHRE VILLA STUCK LOGO
Advertiser/Client :FÖRDERVEREIN VILLA STUCK
Product/Service :20 JAHRE VILLA STUCK POSTER
Entrant Company : ZEICHEN & WUNDER Munich, GERMANY
Advertising Agency : ZEICHEN & WUNDER Munich, GERMANY

Credits

Name Company Position
Michaela Huml Zeichen & Wunder Design
Marc Heckner Zeichen & Wunder Design
Annika Kaltenthaler Zeichen & Wunder Manager/Corporate Design
Julia Peglow-Peters Zeichen & Wunder Manager/Strategy
Irmgard Hesse Zeichen & Wunder Managing Partner
Marcus Von Hausen Zeichen & Wunder Managing Partner

Brief Explanation
The event needed its own striking visual identity to attract the desired target audience as quickly as possible. It was important to clearly set this communication apart from the museum as well as the other exhibitions. The target audience also needed to understand that the event consisted of an exhibition AND an auction – two dates to remember.
 

Describe the brief from the client
In 2012, Munich's Villa Stuck celebrated its twentieth anniversary as a municipal museum and foundation. The Villa Stuck friends´association planned a charity exhibition and auction to mark this occasion.
 

Design Process

The motto of the event was "20Stuck" ("20pieces"), as the 20-year anniversary exhibition displayed 20 works from 20 different artists. The striking key visual playfully combines the figures "2" and "0", which can be read as “20” and “02”. This illustrates the motto and concept of the event, along with the combination of the two dates. We were hired to develop the design and all marketing materials for the event, specifically a series of posters.
 

Results

The exhibition and auction were very successful. All 20 artworks were auctioned off at substantial prices. All funds benefit the Villa Stuck foundation, enabling the organization to purchase extraordinary works of art for the museum.
